data.name: User_Validation_Email_Check
data.value: The email field does not contain a valid email.

data.name: User_Validation_PasswordTooShort
data.value: The password is less than {0} characters

data.name: Signup_Complete_Label
data.value: Thank you, an email has been sent to {0} with details on how to complete the signup.

data.name: Signup_Error_General
data.value: An error occurred with the signup.

data.name: Signup_Error_Recaptcha
data.value: The two words for the anti-spam box were incorrect

data.name: Activate_Label
data.value: Your account has been sucessfully activated.

data.name: Activate_Error
data.value: There was a problem activating your account. It may have already been activated.

data.name: ResetPassword_Label
data.value: Enter your email below to reset your password. You will then receive an email with a link to reset your password.

data.name: ResetPassword_Invalid_Label
data.value: The password reset key is no longer valid.

data.name: ResetPassword_EmailSent_Title
data.value: Your password reset request was sent.

data.name: ResetPassword_EmailSent_Label
data.value: Thank you, an email has been sent to {0} with details on how to reset your password.

data.name: ResetPassword_Error
data.value: The passwords do not match, or are too short

data.name: ResetPassword_Error_ServerError
data.value: The password reset failed from a server error.

data.name: ResetPassword_Error_EmailNotFound
data.value: The email address could not be found

data.name: Profile_Error
data.value: An error occurred updating your profile

data.name: NoMainPage_Label
data.value: To set a main page, create a page and assign the tag 'homepage' to it.

data.name: Search_NoResults
data.value: Your search '{0}' did not match any pages

data.name: EditPage_AdminOnly
data.value: This page can only be edited by administrators.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_CachePageText
data.value: (This key is no longer used. To be removed in 2.0)

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_SiteName_Help
data.value: The name of the site, which appears on certain themes and in signup emails (if enabled).

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_SiteUrl_Help
data.value: The url of the site, which is used in signup and reset password emails. Do not include the trailing slash.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_ConnectionStrings_Help
data.value: Changes your connection string. Note: Roadkill won't automatically recreate the database structure.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_DatabaseType_Help
data.value: Changes the database type you're using. Note: Roadkill won't automatically recreate the database structure

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_UseWindowsAuth_Help
data.value: {bold}WARNING{/bold} changing this may lock you out of the site. Make a backup of your web.config first before saving.{br}{br} Sets whether to use Windows Authentication and Active Directory for authentication.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_AllowUserSignups_Help
data.value: Check this option if you want to allow people to signup as a new users. If left unchecked, only admins will be able to create new users.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_EnableRecaptcha_Help
data.value: Enable Recaptcha support - a free anti-spam bot service. You will need to signup and copy your public and private key into the fields below.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_RecaptchaPrivateKey_Help
data.value: The private key for Recaptcha, which is provided when you signup with recaptcha.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_RecaptchaPublicKey_Help
data.value: The public key for Recaptcha, which is provided when you signup with recaptcha.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_AD_Connection_Help
data.value: The LDAP connection string for the Active Directory connection.This should be in the format LDAP://mydc01.company.internal (it should be uppercase LDAP).

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_AD_Username_Help
data.value: The username to authenticate against the Active Directory with. Leave blank if the app pool is running under a user with this permission.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_AD_Password_Help
data.value: The password to use for authentication.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_EditorRole_Help
data.value: This is the name of the editor role - people who can edit and create pages. This is only used for Active Directory/Windows authentication - leave this blank to allow all users to be editors.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_AdminRole_Help
data.value: {bold}WARNING{/bold} changing this may lock you out of the site when using Active Directory/Windows authentication. Make a backup of your web.config first before saving. {br}{br}This is the name of the admin role. Admins have the same rights as editors, but also have access to configuration settings and tools for the site.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_MarkupType_Help
data.value: This is the markup format that is used. Roadkill currently supports the following values: Creole, Markdown, Mediawiki.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_Theme_Help
data.value: This is the theme that the site uses. This should match a folder name in the Themes directory.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_Attachments_Help
data.value: This is the directory where all files are uploaded to. This setting should start with ~/ to indicate the site root folder.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_Extensions_Help
data.value: These are the file extensions that can be uploaded, comma separated.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_ObjectCaching_Help
data.value: Enables Object caching. Roadkill caches all pages and content in memory after retrieving it from the database. The cache is automatically updated when a page changes. Recommended to increase the responsiveness of the site. Object caching is not currently supported for web gardens or web farms.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_BrowserCaching_Help
data.value: Enables caching on the browser. This will tell the browser to cache Roadkill pages, and check for updates (If-Modified-Since) each time the page is loaded. If no update is found, no content is returned from the server. Recommended to increase the responsiveness of the site.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_Caching_Help
data.value: (This key is no longer used. To be removed in 2.0)

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_CachePageText_Help
data.value: (This key is no longer used. To be removed in 2.0)

data.name: SiteSettings_UserManagement_AddUser_Help
data.value: For existing users, leave the password fields blank to change just the username.

data.name: SiteSettings_UserManagement_AddUser_Error
data.value: Unable to save the user details:

data.name: SiteSettings_UserManagement_AD_Label1
data.value: User names and passwords are not editable with Windows authentication - you should do this through Active Directory.

data.name: SiteSettings_UserManagement_AD_Label2
data.value: To add a user as an admin or editor, make sure they are part of the Windows security group that you have specified for the "AdminRolename" and "EditorRolename" settings in the web.config.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ClearDatabase_Label
data.value: Clears all pages and text from the database. This does not remove any users.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_RebuildSearch_Label
data.value: Forces a re-build of the page search index, useful if the search begins to get out of sync for any reason.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ExportXml_Label
data.value: Exports all page text content and all history as a single XML file.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ExportContent
data.value: Export all content as a zip

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ExportContent_Label
data.value: Exports all pages, including text content as a series of ".wiki" files. Only the current content and tags are included, no history is provided. This zip file does not include the attachments folder.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ExportAttachments_Label
data.value: Exports all the contents of attachments folder and subfolders as a zip file.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_ScrewTurnImport_Label
data.value: Imports all content from a Screwturn 2/3 database. You will need to set the markuptype to MediaWiki in the settings/web.config file for the format to be compatible. As screwturn uses as variation on the mediawiki syntax, some content will not render perfectly. This includes some images and links.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_RenameTag_Label
data.value: This will rename a tag, and update all pages that reference the tag to use the new tagname. The tagname is case sensitive.

data.name: SiteSettings_Validation_AttachmentsReservedName
data.value: '~/Files' is a reserved path, please choose another attachments folder.

data.name: FileManager_Delete_Confirm
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete {0}?

data.name: FileManager_Error_DirectoryListing
data.value: An error occurred getting the directory listing:

data.name: FileManager_Error_DeleteFolder
data.value: An error occurred deleting the folder:

data.name: FileManager_Error_DeleteFile
data.value: An error occurred deleting the file:

data.name: FileManager_Error_CreateFolder
data.value: An error occurred creating the folder:

data.name: FileManager_Help
data.value: Drag files onto the box below to upload. Double click to navigate folders.

data.name: FileManager_Extension_Not_Supported
data.value: Only files with the extension {0} can be uploaded.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_HeadContent_Help
data.value: Any additional HTML or scripts you enter here will be added to the {head} tag of the page.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_NavMenu_Help
data.value: The navigation menu, which is typically on the left hand side but varies according to the theme. Markup is accepted and should be done in the markdown format your wiki uses. You can also use the following tokens which are replaced with links (some of which may be empty if you are not logged in): {MENUTOKENS}

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_FileManager_OverwriteExisting
data.value: Automatically overwrite existing files on upload

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_FileManager_OverwriteExisting_Help
data.value: Check this if you want file names that already exist in the attachments folder to be automatically overwritten.

data.name: SiteSettings_Tools_SqlExport_Label
data.value: Exports the current database as a single SQL script. If you are using MongoDB this action does nothing.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_IsPublicSite_Help
data.value: When un-checked, all pages are private and can only be viewed by logged in users.

data.name: SiteSettings_Configuration_IgnoreSearchIndexErrors_Help
data.value: When checked, an error is displayed when a page fails to be indexed by the Lucene search engine (when creating or updating a page), instead of being ignored.

data.name: History_Help_Label
data.value: Click on a version number to compare the changes with version before it.

data.name: Attachments_Folder_Success
data.value: Success! The directory exists and can be written to.

data.name: Attachments_Folder_Failure
data.value: Unable to write to the attachments directory:

data.name: Profile_Not_Available
data.value: Windows authentication is enabled, so the user profile is not available.

data.name: Profile_Details_Updated_Successfully
data.value: The profile details were successfully updated.

data.name: Profile_Leave_Password_Blank
data.value: Leave the password fields blank if you do not want to change your password.

data.name: SiteSettings_Cache_Key_Format
data.value: The keys are in the format:

data.name: Recaptcha_Prompt
data.value: As an anti-spam measure, please enter the two words below

data.name: SiteSettings_Cache_Not_Enabled
data.value: The object cache is not currently enabled.
